results.title: How to use the telephone
results.creator_credit: Public Relations Films, H M Treasury and Michael Law
results.brief_description: A training film made for use in Government (British) departments pointing out common mistakes in using the telephone and showing how a proper understanding of the relationship between caller, switchboard and extension-user can save a great deal of valuable time and energy.

results.title: How to use the reader's guide to periodical literature (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Nassau Library (New York, N.Y.) and Roger Wade Productions
results.brief_description: Describes the scope, uses and features of this periodicals index, and explains the structure of the headings, arrangement and abbreviations in the entries. Presented in an interesting spy story format.

results.title: How to use the multiplan package
results.brief_description: A video self-teaching accounting, budgeting and finance package that includes a workbook, videocassette and diskette. Note: the diskette can be used only with IBM hardware and Multiplan software.

results.title: How to use classroom films
results.brief_description: This film introduces the basic principles necessary for an effective presentation and utilisation of a classroom film. It illustrates methods of choosing and reserving a film, pre-viewing, preparing the class, and initiating a follow-up discussion.

results.title: How to train with video: how to choose them and use them to fast-forward training in your organization
results.creator_credit: CareerTrack Publications and Matthew A Keller
results.brief_description: This program shows how video can be used in training. Topics such as what to look for in video training, what kinds of programs are available, the benefits of training using video and how to set up an overall video training program.

results.title: How to take the right risks: the manager as decision maker
results.creator_credit: Pare Lorentz Jr, BNA Communications and Ameron
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “The Manager and the Organization”.
All decisions involve an element of risk. The issues must be carefully defined and all alternatives considered. Also if it is not an isolated incident, it is desirable to establish a policy for dealing with similar situations. Narrated by Peter Drucker.

results.title: How to supervise
results.creator_credit: Francis Gysin, National Coal Board and David Pitt
results.brief_description: Defines the responsibilities of the supervisor and reinforces the need for a civilised relationship between supervisor and trainee, by giving hints for supervisors on how they should attend to the training and safety of young entrants under their charge. Although made for the coal industry most of the ideas are generally applicable.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Francis Gysin, National Coal Board and David Pitt
results.description: Defines the responsibilities of the supervisor and reinforces the need for a civilised relationship between supervisor and trainee, by giving hints for supervisors on how they should attend to the training and safety of young entrants under their charge.
